description: Learn a new alphabet by reading a good text in your native alphabet with more and more foreign letters.
teaser:
Alphabetify makes learning new alphabets easy. Copypaste any text to the upper text area â€“ the breaking news, your favourite book, or a piece of homework. Alphabetify will transform the text for you. It starts with all symbols in your native alphabet, then slowly introduces more and more foreign characters. You will get used to them and learn the alphabet without any effort.

Try it!
note: Note: The sample text is very short for demonstration purposes. You should probably choose a longer text, so that you can slowly get used to every single new letter.
contributing: If you would like to contribute, for example, by pointing out transliteration mistakes or improvements, you are very welcome to do so on Github or via email. Feedback from language teachers on how useful the tool is actually in a real-world environment would also be very appreciated.
sample:
Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?
Thou art more lovely and more temperate:
Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May,
And summer's lease hath all too short a date:
Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines,
And often is his gold complexion dimm'd;
And every fair from fair sometime declines,
By chance, or nature's changing course, untrimm'd;
But thy eternal summer shall not fade
Nor lose possession of that fair thou ow'st;
Nor shall Death brag thou wander'st in his shade,
When in eternal lines to time thou grow'st;
So long as men can breathe or eyes can see,
So long lives this, and this gives life to thee.
